metadata.name: Self-Care App Design System
metadata.description: Complete design system for the self-care PWA with matcha color palette, Fraunces + Epilogue typography, and calm, organic aesthetic

colorSystem.structure: Semantic roles with 5 intensity levels (50/100/500/700/900) per role. Neutrals adapt per palette theme for cohesion.

matcha.name: Matcha (Default)
matcha.description: Earthy, warm tones with matcha green primary and dusty rose accents

primary.name: Matcha Green
primary.usage: Main actions, health indicators, completed states

secondary.name: Hojicha Tan
secondary.usage: Secondary actions, alternative buttons, less prominent UI

success.name: Success Green (derived from Primary)
success.usage: Success messages, completion indicators, positive feedback

warning.name: Muted Amber
warning.usage: Needs attention, cat feeding reminder, streak at risk

accent.name: Dusty Rose
accent.usage: Rewards, cat elements, special moments, achievements

specialGradients.description: Multi-color gradients for special cards (bundles, cat modal, challenges). These can go outside the main palette for visual interest.

gradient.description: Subtle bottom-to-top gradient (warmer at top). Future: will animate and respond to time-of-day.

futureThemes.note: Additional palettes will follow the same semantic structure with different hue families. Neutrals will adapt temperature to match each palette.

body.usage: Body text, UI elements, buttons, labels

weights.description: Option B: Moderate throughout - softer, more uniform hierarchy

scale.description: Generous scale (Option A) for glanceability and impact. Base body text is 16px for mobile readability.

spacing.description: Option C: Mixed scale - 4px for micro spacing (icon gaps, tight elements), 8px base for macro spacing (card padding, section gaps). Efficient density to fit more content per screen.

borderRadius.description: Option D: Mixed system - highest roundness for primary buttons and badges (draws attention), moderate for cards, subtle for secondary controls.

usage.primaryButton: 24px or full (pill-like for maximum press appeal)

shadows.description: Very subtle shadows (Option A) to maintain calm aesthetic. Used for card separation from gradient background.

interactions.description: Combined approach: Scale + Shadow changes (tactile) PLUS color darkening (visual clarity). Maximum feedback - both physical and visual for most satisfying interactions.

hover.description: Lifts up + stronger shadow + subtle darkening

active.description: Returns to position + lighter shadow + slightly darker

styles.usage: Outline for inactive/default states, filled for active/selected states (e.g., navigation tabs)

icons.systemUIUsage: Use Phosphor icons for system UI: navigation, settings, edit/delete actions, system controls. Icons provide structured, professional feel for app infrastructure.

emojis.style: 3D/Color (use Color/SVG version for web, 3D/PNG for native if needed)
emojis.usage: Use emojis for personal/content elements: goals, rewards, bundles, cat representation. Emojis add warmth and personality to user-facing content.

implementation.goals: User selects emoji when creating goal. Provide preset suggestions per goal type (üßò meditation, üìö reading, üèÉ exercise, etc.)
implementation.rewards: Fixed emojis per reward type (‚òï coffee, üìö book, üé≠ movie, etc.)
implementation.bundles: Fixed emojis per bundle (üöø hygiene, üí™ wellness, üìö librarian, üç≥ meal prep, etc.)

iconVsEmojiGuideline.useIcons: System UI, navigation, settings, actions (edit/delete), structural elements
iconVsEmojiGuideline.useEmojis: Goals, rewards, bundles, mood indicators, cat, personal content
iconVsEmojiGuideline.principle: Icons for infrastructure, emojis for personality

components.description: Core component specifications following the design system rules

colored.background: Can use semantic colors (primary.50, accent.100, etc.) - SOLID only
colored.usage: Bundle progress, reward cards, mood cards

special.background: CAN use multi-color gradients (like ramen UI reference)
special.gradient: YES - two-color pastel gradients for visual interest
special.usage: Challenge bundles, cat modal, major milestone cards

floatingCat.interactions: Opens cat modal on tap, scale 1.1 on hover

desktop.behavior: Container max-width 900px, centered with margin: 0 auto
desktop.layout: Same single-column layout as mobile, just wider

responsive.consistency: All tabs/screens use identical container width and padding. Content never shifts horizontally when switching tabs.

background.future: Will animate (slow color flow) and respond to time-of-day

cardSeparation.principle: Cards must visually separate from gradient background
cardSeparation.avoidance: Never let card gradients mush with background gradient

gradientUsage.specialCards: YES - when large and special enough
gradientUsage.readability: Always prioritize text readability over visual effects

density.approach: Efficient spacing (Option C) - fits more content without feeling cramped

designPrinciples.aesthetic: Organic/natural, soft/pastel, refined minimalism with warmth
designPrinciples.personality: Calm, intentional, literary (serif headings for book-lovers), gentle
designPrinciples.userExperience: Fast access, uncluttered, no guilt/pressure, encouraging
designPrinciples.differentiation: Warmth through typography and color, tactile interactions, literary sophistication
keyRules: Buttons never have gradients - always solid colors
Regular cards never have gradients - solid only
Special cards (challenges, milestones) CAN have decorative gradients
Text must always be readable - no low-contrast on gradients
Interactions feel physical and satisfying (scale + shadow)
Cat is minimal presence (floating button) to avoid distraction
Icons use outline by default, filled when active
Neutrals adapt per palette for maximum cohesion

contrast.verification: All neutral.900 text on neutral.50 backgrounds passes at ~15:1

touchTargets.buttons: Meet or exceed minimum naturally with padding
touchTargets.icons: Ensure adequate tap area even if visual is smaller

focusStates.keyboard: Add visible focus ring (2px primary.500 with offset)
focusStates.implementation: Follow browser defaults or custom ring
